The Graduate Student Association (GSA), in partnership with the Graduate College and Office of Research, hosts the annual Drexel Emerging Graduate Scholars (DEGS) Conference, a free, student-run, University-wide conference highlighting Drexel's most impactful graduate students' research.

From: Graduate Student List for GSA <GRADS@LISTS.DREXEL.EDU> On Behalf Of Drexel Graduate Student Association
Sent: Friday, February 14, 2020 12:59 PM
To: GRADS@LISTS.DREXEL.EDU
Subject: GSA Newsletter 2/14

 

 

 

 

News & Announcements:

 

 

Let’s dance the night away....until 10..... at the Drexel Graduate Student Winter Formal hosted by Drexel GSA, BSGSA and ICO GSA!! We will be co-hosting it at Tendenza by Cescaphe on February 29 from 6-10 PM. Drinks and food will be provided with the purchase of a ticket!

Ticket Link

 

 

The Graduate Student Association (GSA), in partnership with the Graduate College and Office of Research, hosts the annual Drexel Emerging Graduate Scholars (DEGS) Conference, a free, student-run, University-wide conference highlighting Drexel's most impactful graduate students' research.

The conference provides opportunities for graduate students to participate in pre-conference professional development workshops, showcase their research (at any level) to those outside of their academic discipline, network with student peers, postdocs, alumni, faculty and professional staff from across the University and compete for monetary awards.

Abstract submissions for poster, oral, demonstration presentation (exhibit your app, art, or prototype) and three minute thesis (3MT) presentations are OPEN. All graduate levels and programs welcome and encouraged to submit. For more information on the presentations click on this here.

Submission Link

Upcoming Events:

 

Association for Women in Science
Essential Strategies for Negotiating

 

 

An interactive professional development program led by Ana E. Núñez, MD, 6 p.m., Wednesday, February 26, 2020, at the University of the Sciences. Dr. Núñez is a professor of medicine; associate dean, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion; and the director of the National Center of Excellence in Women's Health and Women's Health Education Program at Drexel University College of Medicine in Philadelphia.

Register: awisphl.org/events/feb2020/

 

 

Drexel University Center City Campus Three Parkway, Room 1043
Saturday, February 29th

9:30 AM - 12:30 PM

 

3401 Market Street, Room 3014
Wednesday, February 19th, 2020
12:00 - 1:00 PM

 

Workshops:

 

TEACHING AND LEARNING CENTER
Winter 2020 Workshops

 

 

Podcast Discussion: Developing Critical Thinking Skills
Blackboard and VoiceThread
February 3rd to 17th

Do you enjoy talking about teaching, but have difficulty finding time to participate in workshops? If you answered yes, then this discussion group is for you! Instead, participants will receive instructions for participation over the course of two weeks which include 1) listening to the podcast 2) answering initial discussion prompts 3) responding to colleagues’ posts; and 4) providing final reflections. 

Connecting the Classroom with Co-op:
﻿Strategies that Deepen Learning
Hagerty Library Room L13-B
Thurs. March 5th & 12th
1:00 - 2:30 PM
Did you know that research shows college students are more motivated to learn when they make direct connections between what they are learning in class and their future careers? In this interactive workshop, we will explore the logistics of making explicit links between co-op and classroom learning and hear how two Drexel faculty members are making intentional connections to co-op in their classrooms. 

 

Join us for workshops on Networking, Self-Care and Wellness, and Yoga and Meditation.  The Keynote Address will be presented by Valerie Gay, the Deputy Director for Audience Engagement and Chief Experience Officer at the Barnes Foundation.  The panel discussion will feature a conversation with Mother and Daughter Entrepreneurs/Business Leaders, Claudia Timbo of CompanyVoice and Sunny White of Xavier Creative House. At 3pm, a special Proving Ground Pop Up featuring female Drexel entrepreneurs will open up in conjunction with a cocktail networking reception, beginning at 4pm. 
 
Please RSVP here.
 
Questions? Email Melissa at mt3288@drexel.edu.

 

 

CIES GENDER AND EDUCATION STANDING COMMITTEE

Feminist Mentoring Workshop: Creating Feminist Mentorship

12-WEEK EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING WORKSHOP & SUPPORT GROUP

With Elvan Kama Kurtz, MFT

 

Wednesday, February 26, 2020
3:30 pm - 5:00 pm
On the subject of Fostering Feminist Mentorship, it will cover how to identify potential mentors and feminist mentors, develop feminist mentorship within existing mentoring and/or developmental relationships, and utilize/ leverage feminist mentoring relationships to excel within your field/organization, while de-constructing gendered and racialized cultures. Expert panelists will include Dr. Supriya Baily, Associate Professor, College of Education and Human Development, George Mason University, and Dr. Claudia Mitchell, James McGill Professor, Department of Integrated Studies in Education, McGill University. 

Register Online!

Wednesdays for 12 wks starting 4/1

8:30 PM

This workshop is for undergraduate and graduate students up to 25 years old struggling with stress, anxious, and depressed thoughts or life transitions. Each week we will discuss topics including managing anxiety, navigating stress to life transitions, adaptations, self care and relationships. All genders and international students welcome!
 

More on Elvan at BetterBeingMainLine.com and Linktr.ee/ekk_mft 

 

Job Opportunities:

 

Position Title: OED Student Assistant

Reports to: Program Coordinator - Testing, Assistive Technology & Employee Accommodations

 

 

General:

The OED Student Assistant is an integral member of the department and contributes to achieving the mission in advocating for people with disabilities and providing equal opportunities and equal access to education, employment, programs and activities at Drexel University. This position is physically located within the alternative testing space on both the University City Campus and the Center City Campus.

Experience:

  • Have the ability to work at least 20 hours per week between the hours of 7:30am and 5:30pm, Monday through Friday
  • Possess excellent communication, organization, time management, and writing skills

NO EXPERIENCE IS REQUIRED!

If interested, please submit your resume and cover letter to Monique Mallory: mmallory@drexel.edu

 

If you can't afford to pay the living wage, you can't afford a full-time doctoral student worker.

Please be advised that e-mail announcements are the primary method of communication between GSA and graduate students. If you have an event that you would like to placed in the newsletter than fill out this form.

Additionally, you are receiving this newsletter because you are enrolled in a quarter graduate program at Drexel University. If for any reason you would like to unsubscribe from this listserv and all materials sent through it, please send an email to listserv@lists.drexel.edu with text "signoff GRADS" or reply with your request and someone will assist you.
